content.raw: Actually, it is a bit worse than that.  We have a number of calls to xml.LoadFile()/xml.Parse() all over the source code, and they all report errors slightly differently.  We should probably add a helper function that parses a filename or string, and then prints out a good error message.  Then we should use it consistently.
content.html: Actually, it is a bit worse than that. We have a number of calls to xml.LoadFile()/xml.Parse() all over the source code, and they all report errors slightly differently. We should probably add a helper function that parses a filename or string, and then prints out a good error message. Then we should use it consistently.
